text:
The shared classloader should look in $CATALINA_BASE/classes
and $CATALINA_BASE/lib for jar files.  This would allow
each instance of Tomcat 4 to run with a different version
of jar files.
creator: billa@cnet.com
remm@apache.org
text:
That looks like a reasonable enhancement (recategorized "bug" ...). Is it ok, 
Craig, or would that cause trouble ?

creator: billa@cnet.com
text:
I am currently running Tomcat 3.2.1.  I am using the "-h"
option to run multiple instances with one binary installation.
Each instance has its own "lib" directory which enable me to
use different versions of jar files for each instance.
I would like to see this "feature" in Tomcat 4.0 also.
I have looked at the source code.  All this is needed is
to change the shared classloader to look in CATALINA_BASE/lib
and CATALINA_BASE/classes instead of CATALINA_HOME.

This has been changed in the HEAD branch.
I don't feel like porting it to 4.0.x. as it may break some existing 
deployments.
creator: remm@apache.org
